title: Coding Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of programming languages, concepts, and software development.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a JavaScript data type?
questions.explanation: JavaScript does not have a specific 'Float' data type. It uses 'Number' for both integers and floating-point numbers.

questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, which is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in HTML.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a programming paradigm?
questions.explanation: Descriptive Programming is not a recognized programming paradigm. The main paradigms include Object-Oriented, Functional, Procedural, and Declarative.

questions.question: What is the time complexity of binary search?
questions.explanation: Binary search has a time complexity of O(log n), making it much more efficient than linear search for large datasets.

questions.question: Which of the following is a NoSQL database?
questions.explanation: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that uses a document-oriented data model, while MySQL, PostgreSQL, and Oracle are relational databases.

questions.question: What does API stand for?
questions.explanation: API stands for Application Programming Interface, which is a set of rules that allows different software applications to communicate with each other.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a version control system?
questions.explanation: Docker is a platform for developing, shipping, and running applications in containers, not a version control system. Git, Mercurial, and Subversion are version control systems.

questions.question: What is the correct HTML element for the largest heading?
questions.explanation: The <h1> element is used for the largest heading in HTML. Headings range from <h1> (largest) to <h6> (smallest).

questions.question: Which programming language is used for Android app development?
questions.explanation: Kotlin is the preferred language for Android app development. Swift and Objective-C are used for iOS development, while C# is commonly used for Windows applications.

questions.question: What does the acronym 'SOLID' refer to in object-oriented design?
options: Single Responsibility, Open-closed, Liskov substitution, Interface segregation, Dependency inversion
Structured Object Language for Interface Development
questions.correctAnswer: Single Responsibility, Open-closed, Liskov substitution, Interface segregation, Dependency inversion
questions.explanation: SOLID is an acronym for five design principles in object-oriented programming: Single Responsibility, Open-closed, Liskov substitution, Interface segregation, and Dependency inversion.
